title: Yevgeny Primakov obituary | Russia | The Guardian

quotes: Yevgeny Primakov, who has died aged 85, was an outstanding foreign minister and prime minister of the Russian Federation in the 1990s.
In 1989 Primakov was elected chairman of one chamber of the Supreme Soviet
a year later Gorbachev appointed him to the Presidential Council
During the abortive counter-revolutionary coup by security chiefs and Communist party conservatives in August 1991, Primakov stayed loyal to Gorbachev.
Under Yeltsin he served as head of the Foreign Intelligence Service until 1996.
Yevgeny Primakov joking with members of the media at the Kremlin, in Moscow, in 1998.

quotes: He spoke Arabic, had served as a foreign correspondent in the Middle East and then headed his country’s top academic thinktanks, the Institute of Oriental Studies and the Institute of World Economy and International Relations.
Yevgeny Primakov joking with members of the media at the Kremlin, in Moscow, in 1998.
